conclusion: A drives in from the lower right direction towards the group of blocks, and the task is to determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop.

The image shows a group of blocks of various colors (purple, yellow, orange, green, light-blue, and red) arranged on a green surface. A toy car labeled 'A' is positioned at the lower right corner, heading towards the blocks.
The first obstacle lying on A’s straight-line path from the lower-right corner is the green cube that sits a little to the right of the main cluster.
A strikes the green cube head-on and knocks it forward and away from the group.
After the impact with the green cube, A still has some forward speed, but the collision robs it of part of its kinetic energy and tips its nose a little to the left.
With the new slightly left-shifted heading, A runs into the next body that is now in line – the light-blue cube that is above and left of the position where the green cube used to be.
The second collision with the light-blue cube is softer because A is already slower, and most of the remaining energy is dissipated here.
Having lost almost all of its momentum, A rolls only a few more centimetres and comes to rest just in front of the two orange cubes that lie in the middle of the formation.
None of the other blocks (purple, yellow, red, the two orange cubes, and the lower green cube) are touched.
A hits exactly two blocks – first the right-hand green cube and then the light-blue cube – and finally stops near the centre of the cluster, in front of the pair of orange cubes.
